popt4jlib

Interface SparseVectorIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, VectorIntf
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DblArray1SparseVector, DblArray1SparseVectorFE, DblArray1SparseVectorMT, FltArray1SparseVector

    public interface SparseVectorIntf
extends VectorIntf
    this interface extends the standard VectorIntf in that it provides two methods to allow for (fast) loops over the non-zero elements of a sparse vector.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getIthNonZeroPos(int i)
      return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector.
      int getNumNonZeros()
      get the number of non-zero elements of this vector.

      • Methods inherited from interface popt4jlib.VectorIntf

        addMul, div, getCoord, getDblArray1, getNumCoords, isAtOrigin, newCopy, newCopyMultBy, newInstance, setCoord

    • Method Detail

      • getNumNonZeros

        int getNumNonZeros()
        get the number of non-zero elements of this vector.
        Returns:
        int

      • getIthNonZeroPos

        int getIthNonZeroPos(int i)
                     throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the index of the i-th non-zero element of this vector. For example, for the vector v=[0 0 1 2 0], the method getIthNonZeroPos(0) will return 2, and the call getIthNonZeroPos(1) will return 3.
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the argument i is <0 or >=getNumCoords(). Also, if this is the zero vector, the method will always throw regardless of the argument passed in.
